title: Score 20% off JetBlue flights to 3 destinations from Boston with Squares4Fares
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: JetBlue offers 20% off flights from Boston to Fort Lauderdale, Daytona Beach, and Phoenix until Feb. 10.
The promo codes depend on the Super Bowl score quarters, valid for travel through March 18, excluding Fridays and Sundays.
Booking with JetBlue's Squares4Fares requires one promo code per booking, with flights subject to availability.

title: State Police academy supervisor and 3 instructors charged with manslaughter in death of recruit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police academy staff charged with manslaughter in recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death.
Delgado-Garcia died from injuries during unsanctioned boxing exercises; academy staff allegedly failed to intervene.
State Police suspended boxing in training and are reviewing policies following an independent investigation into the death.

title: OpenTable names 2 Massachusetts restaurants among the most romantic in the U.S.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Sorellina in Boston and Pellana Steakhouse in Peabody named among OpenTable's Top 100 Romantic Restaurants in the U.S.
OpenTable analyzed over 9 million reviews from Dec. 2024 to Nov. 2025 to compile their romantic restaurants list.
Sorellina offers Italian-Mediterranean cuisine, while Pellana specializes in prime cuts of beef and seafood dishes.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks for February 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix's February additions include 'Ex Machina', 'Hell or High Water', and 'You've Got Mail'.
Catherine O'Hara's performances in 'A Mighty Wind', 'Home Alone', and 'Schitt's Creek' are recommended streaming.
Boston.com staff recommend 'The Pitt' on HBO, 'People You Meet on Vacation' on Netflix, and 'Secret Mall Apartment' on HBO Max.

title: What the Patriots need to do in the off-season, according to readers
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: 79% of readers cite the offensive line as a major issue in the Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Readers suggest Patriots prioritize offensive and defensive line improvements in the offseason.
Bolstering the receiver corps and hiring a new offensive line coach are additional reader recommendations.

title: Springfield dry sausage plant to close, cutting 190 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Smithfield Foods will close its Springfield sausage plant by August, cutting 190 jobs and ending its Massachusetts operations.
The closure is not linked to a recent $140,000 EPA settlement over Clean Air Act violations at the Springfield facility.
Smithfield will move production to other plants and offer transition support to affected workers, including new job opportunities.

title: What Stefon Diggs said about his Patriots future
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs expresses his desire to stay with the Patriots, acknowledging the decision isn't entirely his.
Diggs signed a three-year, $69 million contract with the Patriots, with a commitment through the 2027 season.
Diggs is facing assault charges related to a personal chef incident, but denies allegations and the team supports him.

title: Prosecutor who tried Brian Walshe for murder enters Norfolk DA race
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Greg Connor, a Norfolk County prosecutor, has entered the race for Norfolk District Attorney after securing a guilty verdict in the Brian Walshe murder case.
Connor will resign as prosecutor on March 6 to focus on his DA campaign, emphasizing his extensive experience in Norfolk County.
The 2026 election follows scrutiny of the DA's office's handling of high-profile cases; Connor joins four other candidates in the race.

title: Red Sox land Caleb Durbin in six-player trade with Brewers
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The Boston Red Sox acquired Caleb Durbin from the Milwaukee Brewers in a six-player trade, enhancing their infield roster.
Boston received Caleb Durbin, Andruw Monasterio, Anthony Seigler, and a draft pick, sending three players to Milwaukee.
Caleb Durbin, 25, finished third in NL Rookie of the Year voting in 2025, playing 136 games with a .256 batting average.

title: Former Jets player charged with killing woman from Framingham
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Darron Lee, 31, was charged with killing Gabriella Perpetuo, 29, in Ooltewah, Tennessee, according to the Hamilton County Sheriff's Office.
Lee, a former NFL player, faces first-degree murder and evidence tampering charges; additional charges are possible as the investigation continues.
Perpetuo's family set up a GoFundMe, raising over $53,000 for travel, funeral expenses, and legal costs related to her death.
